intro: Hemizygia albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered hemizygia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, which is characterized by succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure, making it well adapted to its harsh native environment. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
